intro: Diplostephium rhododendroides, commonly known as the Mexican rhododendron, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are thick and leathery, adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. The flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators.
